SEARCH
Package com.oblong.jelly

Class Pool

java.lang.Object
com.oblong.jelly.Pool
public final class Pool extends Object
A collection of functions to operate on pools. Most of these functions are, strictly speaking, redundant, in the sense that you can perform the same operations via PoolServer instances obtained calling any of the equivalent getServer(com.oblong.jelly.PoolServerAddress) and PoolServers.get(com.oblong.jelly.PoolServerAddress, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) factory methods. But the latter can be a bit roundabout when you don't need to keep the PoolServer around and all you want is a quick way to, say, create a pool or obtain a Hose in one shot. The methods in this class allow you to do precisely that, and to ignore the PoolServer API if you wish to.

Half of these functions take a string URI to denote the pool they act upon. Using them you can also be oblivious of PoolAddress and PoolServerAddress if you're so inclined. On the other hand, using instances of this classes instead of strings can help when the rest of your application needs a more robust handling of pool addresses.

All the methods in this class are declared as throwing PoolException, and, since talking with a remote server is involved in all of them, you can expect any kind (meaning, any PoolException.Kind) of error, with the exception of UNCLASSIFIED and USER, and other obvious cases depending on context (e.g., a call to participate won't throw a POOL_EXISTS error).

This is a utility class: you're not expected to (and, actually, cannot) create instances of this type.

  • Method Details

    • getServer

      public static PoolServer getServer(PoolServerAddress address)
      An alias to PoolServers.get(PoolServerAddress), q.v.

    • create

      public static void create(String uri, PoolOptions opts) throws PoolException
      Asks a pool server to create the pool denoted by the given URI, using the corresponding options. The latter can be null, instructing the server to use default values for them. The URI must include, of course, both the server and the pool names.
      Throws:
      PoolException - Possible error kinds include (but are not limited to) PoolException.Kind.POOL_EXISTS (catchable as a PoolExistsException), and PoolException.Kind.BAD_ADDRESS (BadAddressException), with the obvious meanings.

    • create

      public static void create(PoolAddress addr, PoolOptions opts) throws PoolException
      Equivalent to Pool.create(addr.toString(), opts).
      Throws:
      PoolException
      See Also:
      • create(String, PoolOptions)

    • dispose

      public static void dispose(String uri) throws PoolException
      Asks a pool server to eliminate the pool denoted by the given URI. The latter must include, of course, both the server and the pool names.
      Throws:
      PoolException - Possible error kinds include (but are not limited to) PoolException.Kind.NO_SUCH_POOL (catchable as a NoSuchPoolException), and PoolException.Kind.BAD_ADDRESS (BadAddressException), with the obvious meanings.

    • dispose

      public static void dispose(PoolAddress addr) throws PoolException
      Equivalent to Pool.dispose(addr.toString()).
      Throws:
      PoolException
      See Also:
      • dispose(String)

    • participate

      public static Hose participate(String uri) throws PoolException
      Establishes a connection with the pool denoted by the given URI. If no exceptions are thrown, you can rely on the returned Hose to be non-null and ready to use (although of course nothing prevents the network connection to go awry in the meantime).
      Throws:
      PoolException - In particular, a PoolException of kind PoolException.Kind.NO_SUCH_POOL (catchable as a NoSuchPoolException) will be thrown if the requested pool does not exist.

    • participate

      public static Hose participate(PoolAddress addr) throws PoolException
      Equivalent to Pool.participate(addr.toString()).
      Throws:
      PoolException
      See Also:
      • participate(String)

    • participate

      public static Hose participate(String uri, PoolOptions opts) throws PoolException
      Tries to establish a connection with the pool denoted by the given URI. If the pool exists, opts is ignored; otherwise, they'll be used to create a new pool with the given options. Either way, you'll get back a Hose connected to the pool, with the same guarantees as with participate(String).
      Throws:
      PoolException - No errors of kind PoolException.Kind.POOL_EXISTS or PoolException.Kind.NO_SUCH_POOL will be thrown.

    • participate

      public static Hose participate(PoolAddress addr, PoolOptions opts) throws PoolException
      Equivalent to Pool.participate(addr.toString(), opts).
      Throws:
      PoolException
      See Also:
      • participate(String, PoolOptions)

    • pools

      public static Set<String> pools(String serverURI) throws PoolException
      Equivalent to Pool.pools(PoolServerAddress.fromURI(serverURI)).
      Throws:
      PoolException
      See Also:
      • pools(PoolServerAddress)

    • pools

      public static Set<String> pools(PoolServerAddress addr) throws PoolException
      Returns a list of the names of pools in the given server. Note that the returned names are not full URIs: you need to add to them the server address to operate on them using the rest of methods in this class. For instance, the following code removes all pools in a given server: 
          PoolServerAddress sa =
        PoolServerAddress.fromURI("tcp://poolish-host.com:1020");
    for (String name : Pools.pools(sa))
      Pool.dispose(new PoolAddress(sa, name));
      Throws:
      PoolException

    • exists

      public static boolean exists(PoolAddress addr) throws PoolException
      Checks whether the given pool exists.
      Throws:
      PoolException
